title: Vertical Traffic Light

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

bn:00101423a: Showing the way by conducting or leading; imposing direction on

bn:00089154v: To come to a halt; to cease moving.
To halt a process or action, typically without restoring the prior state.
Come to a halt, stop moving

bn:00093733v: Communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs

bn:00074441n: Signalling device to control competing flows of traffic
A traffic light (from earlier robot policeman).

Traffic lights, also known as traffic signals, traffic lamps, signal lights, stop lights and robots, and also known technically as traffic control signals are signalling devices positioned at road intersections, pedestrian crossings and other locations to control competing flows of traffic.
A traffic control signal, traditionally consisting of three lights, colored green, yellow/amber and red, meaning proceed, prepare to stop and stop, respectively.
A signaling device to control the flow of traffic.
A visual signal to control the flow of traffic at intersections
Signal lights controlling automotive & pedestrian traffic flow

bn:00051108n: Electromagnetic radiation that is capable of causing a visual sensation.

Light is electromagnetic radiation with a wavelength that is visible to the eye or, in a technical or scientific context, the word is sometimes used to mean electromagnetic radiation of all wavelengths.
Object, natural or artificial, that produces light.
(physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation
A property in graphic design software that makes objects visible, much like light in the natural world.
Light is radiant energy, usually referring to electromagnetic radiation that is visible to the human eye, and is responsible for the sense of sight.

bn:00078004n: A facility consisting of the means and equipment necessary for the movement of passengers or goods
Shared passenger transport service which is available for use by the general public
The act or the means of conveying people in mass as opposed to conveyance in private vehicles.
Any form of transport that can be used by a member of public (usually for a fee); as opposed to private ownership of e.g. cars.

Public transport is a shared passenger transport service which is available for use by the general public, as distinct from modes such as taxicab, carpooling or hired buses which are not shared by strangers without private arrangement.
The conveyance of people or goods from one place to another, especially on a public transportation system; the vehicles used for such conveyance.
The conveyance of people or goods from one place to another.

bn:00077888n: Circulation of motor vehicles and people on the road network.
Pedestrians or vehicles on roads or on the air.
In road traffic: right of a vehicle to pass in priority to another one.
The movement of vehicles, ships, aircraft, persons, etc., in an area or over a route.
Traffic on roads may consist of pedestrians, ridden or herded animals, vehicles, streetcars and other conveyances, either singly or together, while using the public way for purposes of travel.
The aggregation of things (pedestrians or vehicles) coming and going in a particular locality during a specified period of time
Pedestrians or vehicles on roads, or the flux or passage thereof.
